This page features regular community polls and surveys to gather input on local marine spatial planning priorities and preferences. Your feedback helps guide LMSP-Tanzania's work and advocacy efforts.

---

### Poll 1: Top Priority for LMSP in Your Community

**What do you consider the highest priority for local marine spatial planning in your coastal community?**

- [ ] Protecting fish stocks and fisheries sustainability
- [ ] Promoting sustainable tourism development
- [ ] Protecting marine biodiversity and habitats
- [ ] Supporting aquaculture and other marine industries
- [ ] Ensuring community food security
- [ ] Creating economic opportunities for youth

**Status:** Active | **Responses:** [Vote now]

---

### Poll 2: Key Stakeholders in Your Area

**Which stakeholders should be most involved in local MSP decisions in your community?**

- [ ] Government fisheries departments
- [ ] Local fisher associations and communities
- [ ] Private sector (tourism, aquaculture)
- [ ] Environmental NGOs
- [ ] Academic and research institutions
- [ ] All equally represented

**Status:** Active | **Responses:** [Vote now]

---

### Poll 3: Main Challenge for LMSP Implementation

**What is the biggest challenge to implementing local MSP in Tanzania?**

- [ ] Lack of awareness among communities
- [ ] Limited technical capacity
- [ ] Insufficient funding
- [ ] Conflicting use demands
- [ ] Weak coordination between agencies
- [ ] Limited data on marine resources

**Status:** Active | **Responses:** [Vote now]

---

### Poll 4: Information Needs

**What type of MSP information would be most useful for your community?**

- [ ] Training and capacity building
- [ ] Maps and spatial data
- [ ] Best practice guides and case studies
- [ ] Links to funding opportunities
- [ ] Networking with other communities
- [ ] Technical support for planning

**Status:** Active | **Responses:** [Vote now]

---

## Past Survey Results

Check back here to see results from completed surveys and how they're influencing LMSP-Tanzania's priorities and initiatives.

---

**Have a suggestion for a poll topic?** Contact us or use the feedback form in our Resources section.

<button class="scroll-to-top" id="scrollToTopBtn" onclick="scrollToTop()">â†‘</button>
<script>
  const scrollBtn = document.getElementById('scrollToTopBtn');
  
  // Show/hide scroll button based on scroll position
  window.addEventListener('scroll', () => {
    if (window.scrollY > 300) {
      scrollBtn.classList.add('show');
    } else {
      scrollBtn.classList.remove('show');
    }
  });
  
  // Scroll to top smoothly
  function scrollToTop() {
    window.scrollTo({
      top: 0,
      behavior: 'smooth'
    });
  }
  
  // Alternative: keyboard shortcut (Press Home key to go to top)
  document.addEventListener('keydown', (e) => {
    if (e.key === 'Home') {
      e.preventDefault();
      scrollToTop();
    }
  });
</script>
